intro: Agathisanthemum bojeri subsp. angolense, commonly known as the Angola starflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces showy, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is known for its composite flower heads. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and floral morphology compared to other members of the species.
